Boston.com
10

Sox get their man; Farrell
to become Boston manager

Ex-Blue Jays manager John Farrell, who was previously the Red Sox pitching coach, will become Boston's new manager, a source said. For compensation, shortstop Mike Aviles will go to Toronto, a source said. (Globe)
  • Survey Right choice for Sox? | Submit Advice for Farrell
  • A 'Dear John' letter from Obnoxious Boston Fan
  • Roster decisions will be Farrell's first order of business
  • Farrell's career | Discuss | Ranking Red Sox managers

Kennedy cousin Skakel up for parole

Michael Skakel, who is serving 20 years to life for the fatal beating of Martha Moxley in 1975, is scheduled for a parole hearing on Wednesday. (AP, 11:45 a.m.)

George McGovern dies at 90

George S. McGovern, who defied the odds to win the Democratic nomination for president in 1972 only to suffer one of the worst electoral defeats in US history, died today, a family spokesperson said. (Globe)
  • Sen. John Kerry: McGovern was 'voice of clarity'
  • Clintons remember McGovern for anti-hunger efforts
  • Guest book  |  Pictures McGovern's life  |  Notable deaths
